newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGBS TO CONSOLIDATE, TOPSIDE HEAVY.
newsitem.headline: JGBS TO CONSOLIDATE, TOPSIDE HEAVY.

text.p: Japanese government bonds (JGBs) are expected to consolidate at relatively high levels during Tokyo trade Tuesday, but substantial rises unlikely as many investors are out on summer vacations, traders said.
The market will closely watch moves in Tokyo stocks after Monday's fall of nearly four percent, but buying on this alone unlikely unless Nikkei shows signs of breaking below 18,000.

JGBs showed little response to Monday's fall, which saw the Nikkei close at 18,824.18, down 780.28, mainly due to a lack of investor participation on the summer holiday. Dealer wariness of bidding bonds much higher also weigh down gains.
Brokers said moves in stocks today were expected to be mixed, with caution over active buying likely to offset any temptation for bargain-hunting.
Bond traders said there was a slight chance that further stock falls could lead to bond sales as operators sought to balance out their losses, but most felt the downside would hold near 126.40.

The dollar's rise above 116 yen means it is unlikely to have much impact as a direct factor for bonds. But this could possibly weigh on the topside should a dollar rise help stocks recover, keeping bond rises capped near 126.80.
